page.title: 05The South Downs Way
page.content:
The South Downs Way is a footpath which stretches from Beachy Head to South Harting,Hampshire. Important land marks can be seen in this area including the Long Man of Wilmington and other features of historical importance.
The view from the top of Windover Hill is spectacular. The view includes the villages of Wilmington and Alfriston while in the distance is Arlington Reservoir and Firle Beacon. The scene is of a typical British countryside.
On the South Downs Way there is a lot of wildlife to be seen such as wild rabbits and kestrels hovering above the Downs. Near Windover Hill enthusiasts often fly radio controlled aircraft.
